title: Drawing, "Pales, Triptolemus, Decoration for a Vault, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi", 1787–1802
medium: Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash over black chalk on laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in ink: Pale inv de pascoli, Tritolamo inve del aratro.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Pales holding shepherd staff shown in profile, seated beneath tree.  Flock of goats and sheep presses around well.  Inscription, Pale inv de pascoli. At right, Triptolemus holds reins of two snakes drawing plow chariot, inscribed Tritolamo inve del aratro.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Pales, Triptolemus, Decoration for a Vault, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi", 1787–1802.
1787–1802. Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash over black chalk on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3431.
